data.title: Fixed keybinding json for backslash
data.body:
Hello, this is a possible solution for issue #21657 

Short description:
Check with regex whether backslash is found, if so add double backslash otherwise keybindings JSON will be invalid

data.title: Promise static method give error
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.1 (653f8733dd5a5c43d66d7168b4701f94d72b62e5, 2017-03-02T00:47:58.633Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-64-generic
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-markdownlint|DavidAnson|0.6.2|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.4.0|
|sort-lines|Tyriar|1.2.0|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.7|
|tslint|eg2|0.8.1|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.10.2|
|Spell|seanmcbreen|0.9.1|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Code used
```js
let p = Promise.resolve([1, 2, 3]);
p.then(function (v) {
  console.log(v[0]); // 1
});
```
2. Both the compiler and vscode give this error.

```sh
src/main.ts(17,9): error TS2693: 'Promise' only refers to a type, but is being used as a value here.
```

data.title: plugin 'Sorting HTML and Jade attributes' breaks in v1.10.1
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: windows 10 x64 1607

The plugin 'Sorting HTML and Jade attributes' works fine in v1.9.1 but breaks in v1.10.1. It can still sort HTML attributes, but with it installed, the original format function (alt+shift+f) is not working.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. install plugin 'Sorting HTML and Jade attributes': https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=mrmlnc.vscode-attrs-sorter
2. open a HTML file and press alt+shift+f to format it: not working

(https://github.com/mrmlnc/vscode-attrs-sorter/issues/31)

data.title: Chienese Character Width Problem
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10 Version 1607 Build 15042.0

Steps to Reproduce:

1. `echo a` in terminal.
2. `echo 你好` or any Chinese word in terminal.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9292238/23577010/1c6494b2-00ef-11e7-834d-17e088ec6d34.png)


I think it's related to the character width problem, and maybe its a problem for all CJK letters?

data.title: Copy With Syntax Highlighting is picking up background
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 EDU

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Selecting a page of code by using Ctrl + A
2. Copying the selected codes by using Ctrl + C
3. In Word, Paste (with source format), the whole background is there. 
4. In Google Doc, same thing. 

I can see the situation that you WANT to pick up background color, like usually when your color theme is dark, the syntax highlight will be light color. So if they are pasted without dark background, they would be hard to recognized. But it picked up all colored background regardless dark or light. So is that possible to make it pick up  highlight without background as default and make the background is an option for whoever needed? (I never need it tho)

data.title: Perf: Menu takes >100ms on Windows even when not visible

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
No reason to call it before, we should call it as soon as the window starts loading to prevent waterfall on startup.

We can only do this on Windows because on other OS it is possible to interact with the menu before any window is opening. 

Extracted from https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/21643 and related to https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/15455

/cc @jrieken

data.title: Only call setJumpList() after first window is opening
data.body:
No reason to call it before, we should call it as soon as the window starts loading to prevent waterfall on startup.

Extracted from https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/21643 and related to https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/15455

/cc @jrieken

data.title: Add Prompt/Setting to Avoid Committing when Nothing is Staged.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I've hit ctrl+enter too many times with nothing staged and it just commits everything. Having an extra prompt in that case would be nice.

Or, possibly add a setting that could be toggled on which wouldn't allow committing anything unless it has been staged first. So if nothing is staged, nothing would happen. Other than maybe an error saying nothing is staged to commit.

data.title: Show Folder name first in window title (or enable switch between projects)
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->
Thanks for the awesome work!

**Feature Request** : When working on multiple projects, I sometime need to switch between them, but it's hard to figure out which window is associated to which project

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 (and others)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open mutiple folders
2. Open files with sufficiently long names
3. Try to quickly switch folder to the Project you want

Today when clicking on the 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4781476/23575974/f0747612-004c-11e7-8b8e-3ebe03024dee.png) icon : 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4781476/23575947/295de59a-004c-11e7-8830-77d8606301aa.png)

Expected:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4781476/23575955/4cbebe10-004c-11e7-937a-f1f1ba33bf38.png)

Another feature with the same effect could be like Sublime where you can quickly switch between workspaces with [Ctrl Alt P](https://forum.sublimetext.com/t/quick-switch-project-shortcut-doesnt-work-anymore/17261/5)

data.title: Cursor in Search Extension input stops blinking after "Check for Updates"

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Home (v1607; 14393.693)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VSCode
2. Open Extension list -> cursor is blinking in "Search Extensions in Market Place" input
3. Click on the three dots ("More") on the top right over the list
4. Pick "Check for Updates"

Results:

* Cursor in "Search Extensions in Market Place" input will stop blinking and remain visible
* Typing in some characters will add them to the input field and the cursor will change position, but won't blink. Even after emptying the input by deleting all characters, the behavior remains unchanged.

2. Open VS code

Effect: The user cannot be sure which one is the active window. Annoying.

data.title: Fix #21857
data.body: Use current viewport info to predict the view line info after layout change.

data.title: Only column breakpoints should show inline bp indicator
data.body:
My debug adapters return column locations of BPs, even when a column BP wasn't set. As a result, my code ends up full of bp indicators:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/323878/23574308/012b089c-0032-11e7-80df-20126fa22b62.png)

Should we
- only show the column indicators when the user set a column bp
- show the column indicators unless there is only whitespace before that position
- or leave it up to the debug adapter to return a column or not

data.title: Unable to find Electron app at /home/pi/Downloads/vscode
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Newest from git clone
- OS Version: Raspbian newest

Steps to Reproduce:

1 I cloned the vscode app
2. I installed all of the Prerequisites
3. then I did `./scripts/npm.sh --arch=armhf` which ran successfully

Now when I do `./scripts/code.sh` I get this error:

```
Error launching app
Unable to find Electron app at /home/pi/Downloads/vscode

Cannot find module '/home/pi/Downloads/vscode'
```

I've noticed that `vscode/out` folder is almost empty.
Only the `bootstrap-amd.js` file is present.

What could be the problem?

data.title: console.error duplicate
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.1 (653f8733dd5a5c43d66d7168b4701f94d72b62e5, 2017-03-02T00:33:15.706Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.7|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.3.0|;


---

After a recent update, console.error is sending duplicate entries into the debug console.  I've tested the same code outside of the debugger, and using chrome dev tools, and the issue does not happen.  If I run the vs code debugger in legacy mode, it does not happen either.  If I use console.info, it works fine, but using console.error outputs two lines into the debug console.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22228023/23572844/827bed30-0037-11e7-82b6-5e314af18871.png)

data.title: Enable Electron Crash reporter for all processes after Electron update

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Once a newer version (>= 1.5.1)of electron is adopted, all node processes spawned in VS Code need to initialize the crash reporter

https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/master/docs/api/crash-reporter.md#methods

data.title: Emmet extension for expansion and all other actions using the new apis
data.body:
**For April Milestone:**

Emmet features are now modularized in https://www.npmjs.com/%7Eemmetio
For example: https://github.com/emmetio/expand-abbreviation is a stand alone module for the Expand Abbreviation feature from emmet. 

This issue is to track the below emmet features in a VSCode extension using the new APIs and is essentially emmet 2.0

- [x] Get emmet expansions in auto-complete suggestion list
- [x] Wrap with Abbreviation
- [x] Remove Tag
- [x] Update Tag
- [x] Go to Matching Pair

**For May Milestone**

- [x] Balance Inward 
- [x] Balance Outward 
- [x] Split/Join Tags
- [x] Merge Lines
- [x] Toggle Block Comment (html)
- [x] Toggle Block Comment (stylesheet)
- [x] Go to Next/Previous edit point
- [x] Select Next/Previous item (html)
- [x]  Select Next/Previous item (stylesheet)

**Deferred to next Milestone**
- [ ] Increment/Decrement by n
- [ ] Update Image Size
- [ ] Evaluate Math Expression
- [ ] Reflect CSS Value
